main_definition: A firm, in various contexts, refers to an established business entity or a state of being unyielding or steadfast.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An organization that provides professional services, usually on a freelance basis
meanings_and_examples.example: She found a graphic design firm to create her company logo.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Firm or hard in texture; solid and stable
meanings_and_examples.example: The earthquake caused the ground to become firmer underfoot as cracks appeared.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Determined, resolute, not easily swayed or moved by outside influences
meanings_and_examples.example: His firm belief in his principles made him stand up against peer pressure.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A group of businesses under the same ownership that offer related services or products
meanings_and_examples.example: The family owns a chain of law firms, real estate companies, and investment banks collectively known as Smith & Sons Firm.
